chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Adam Steven McAleavey was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Adam Steven McAleavey is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Adam Steven McAleavey was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "H" Felony], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Probation concurrent to 14CF21 but without prejudice to consecutive if revoked.
Court dismisses Counts 2 and 3.

 
In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

Concurrent with:

-Court orders successful completion of Drug Court.

-Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol.

-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
-Defendant to provide a DNA sample.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson.ADA:  Matthew L Hartung   DF ATTY:  Angela Raye Olson   DF:  Adam Steven McAleavey appeared. Case called at 11:20. Includes. 14CF21, 14CF168, 14CF356, 14CF389 and 14TR1739. ADA Hartung makes recommendations. Atty. Olson updates the court. DE has made an application to drug court. Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads G to Ct 1 in 14CF21 and G to Ct 1 in 14CF168. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Court acknowledges prior convictions. Court finds that this is the 5th offense. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 1 in 14CF21 and guilty of Ct. 1 in 14CF168. On motion of the State, Crt dismisses Ct 2 and merge and dismisses Ct 3 in 14CF21 and Ct 2 and 3 in 14CF168. Court also dismisses 14CF356, 14CF389 and 14TR1739. Both sides waive a PSI. Sentencing arguments. BAC is a .292. DE has gone through AODA. DE makes a statement. Crt orders:
In 14CF21 sentence W/H 
- 3 years probation 
  Court extends until the end of this week for Atty's to calculate credi.
  Probation is concurrent without prejudice to consecutive sentencing in the event of Probation revocation.
  Huber granted for work for employment and family needs. 
  Furlough to be considered for the birth of the child. 
Conditions:
-  6 mo St. Croix County Jail as conditional time.
- Court orders Successful completion of drug court. 
- AODA 
- Compliance with a treatment program.
- Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol.
- Random and regular testing. 
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times.This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
- 33 mo. driver's license revocation
- 33 mo. IID
- $85.50 for blood draw
- $2452.00 inclusive of costs, apply bond on file. 
- DNA sample and surcharge.
In 14CF168 
3 years probation concurrent to 14CF21.
- Costs
- same conditions as noted in 14CF21.
- DE not to drive without a valid DL. 
Court will suspend payment plan for 4 months then $50 a month payment plan will be reinstated. 
Bond revoked, DE remanded into custody.

**BOND AMENDED**

**INCLUDES ALL FILES 14CF21, 14CF168, 14CF356, 14CF389 **


-Report every Tuesday and Thursday before 5:00pm  to New Richmond PD for PBT testing, in the presence of an officer or deputy of the same sex.  If PBT tests positive defendant shall submit to additional evidentiary testing to determine the use of substances forbidden by this bond agreement at the jail or Westfield's Hospital.  Defendant must pay $5.00 fee at time of each test.
-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
-Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid license.
-Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. Defendant must pay $5.00 fee at time of each UA test with an officer of the same sex.
